lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and lawmakers in Albany could soon announce an agreement to raise hourly pay to $15, but that minimum might not apply statewide.

headline.print_headline: Exemptions May Color Deal in Albany to Raise Minimum Wage
headline.main: Exemptions May Color Deal to Lift New York State’s Minimum Wage

snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and lawmakers in Albany could soon announce an agreement to raise hourly pay to $15, but that minimum might not apply statewide.
abstract: Proposal by New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo to raise state's minimum wage to $15 an hour could be hobbled by caveats, compromises and exemptions creating hodgepodge of wages and start dates across regions of state; potential exemptions have angered proponents of change and could undercut Cuomo's 'one state' mantra.
